reviewText:
The Maestro, the best there is and ever will be, at His glorious best!  Live in the middle of Central Park - no studio "fixes" here.  Superb mix of arias and Italian folk songs (as only He can do them).  Only thing missing is something from Boheme, but if you love the Pav, you already have Boheme.  The song "Rondine al Nido" is a heart-wringer.  Please find the English translation -- and prepare to weep.  In this selection, Himself goes where tenors fear to tread -- He matches flute!  You'll see.  This is more than a "Concert in the Park" -- this is Pavarotti in all his magnificence.
Laura in the desert

1. Overture - Luisa Miller - Verdi
2. Quando le sure al placido - Luisa Miller - Verdi
3. Rondo russo - Flute concerto - Verdi
4. Fra pocco al me repovero - Lucia del lammermoor - Donizetti
5. Overture - Il vespri sicilliani - Verdi
6. Il lamento del federico
7. Take the A train - Strayhorn
8. It don't mean a thing - Ellington
9. I can't go to God in prayer
10. Mattinata - Leoncavallo
11. Sereneta - Mascagni
12. La mia canzone al vento - Bixio
13. Fantasie del Carmen - Bizet/Borne
14. Chitarra Romana
15. La Girometta
16. Ochii del fata
17. Prelude to Act 3 - La Traviata - Verdi
18. Recondo al nido
19. Non ti scondar di me
20. Pourquoi me revelliar - Wether - Massenet
21. Recondita armonia - Tosca - Puccini
22. E leuceven le stelle - Tosca - Puccini
23. O sole mio
24. Nessun Dorma (of course!)
A wonderful program for a Pavarotti fan. Leone Magiera conducts, Andrea Grimanelli plays flute,
and the Boys Choir of Harlem sings numbers 7-9 very well. You will surely enjoy this.
